entries.title: Pope Francis arrives in Democratic Republic of Congo
entries.description: The pontiff was greeted on a red carpet at Kinshasa Airport by Prime Minister Jean Michel Sama Lukonde, at the start of his visit to a country where half the population is Roman Catholic.

entries.title: 'Hands off Africa!': Pope blasts foreign plundering of Congo
entries.description: Pope Francis began a six-day visit to Congo and South Sudan aiming to bring a message of peace to two countries riven by poverty, conflict and what Francis has called a lingering “colonialist mentality/”

entries.title: In Honduras, authorities order exhumation of a land activist
entries.description: Honduran officials announced the exhumation of land activist Ricardo Arnaúl Montero, members of Garífuna activists said he'd been receiving death threats.

entries.title: U.S. calls on Palestinians and Israelis to de-escalate tension
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with the Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in Ramallah, in the midst of one of the deadliest periods of conflict in the West Bank and east Jerusalem.

entries.title: 'Doppelganger murder': Woman accused of killing Instagram lookalike in plot to fake her own death
entries.description: A 23-year-old woman searched for a lookalike on Instagram and killed her with a friend in order to stage her own death, prosecutors and police in Germany say.

entries.title: U.S. pledges more advanced military support for South Korea
entries.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said the United States will increase its deployment of advanced weapons such as fighter jets and bombers to the Korean Peninsula as it strengthens joint training and operational planning with South Korea.

entries.title: U.S. to increase weapons deployment to counter North Korea
entries.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said the United States will increase its deployment of weapons such as fighter jets and bombers to the Korean Peninsula.

entries.title: Search for lost radioactive capsule stepped up in Australia
entries.description: Australia’s nuclear safety agency said it had joined the hunt for a tiny radioactive capsule missing somewhere in the outback of Western Australia.

entries.title: Western allies differ over fighter jets for Ukraine as Russia claims gains
entries.description: Ukraine’s defense minister is expected in Paris on Tuesday amid a debate among Kyiv’s allies over whether to provide fighter jets for its war against Russia, after President Joe Biden ruled out giving F-16s.

entries.title: As Ukraine waits for foreign tanks, mechanics learn to fix old busted ones
entries.description: An old depot a couple hours from the front lines in eastern Ukraine is now repairing, refurbishing and retrofitting Russian tanks, armored personnel carriers and a mix of other pieces of donated or outdated military equipment.

entries.title: Australian nuclear body joins search for missing radioactive capsule
entries.description: Australia’s nuclear safety agency said on Tuesday it had joined the hunt for a tiny radioactive capsule missing somewhere in the outback, sending a team with specialized car-mounted and portable detection equipment.

entries.title: IMF upgrades outlook for the global economy in 2023
entries.description: The outlook for the global economy is growing slightly brighter as China eases its zero-Covid policies and the world shows surprising resilience in the face of high inflation, elevated interest rates and Russia’s ongoing war against Ukraine.

entries.title: Scores killed after suicide bomber targets mosque in Pakistan
entries.description: A suicide bomber struck a crowded mosque inside a police compound in Pakistan on Monday, causing the roof to collapse.

entries.title: Death toll in Pakistan mosque explosion rises to 90
entries.description: The death toll from a suicide bombing at a mosque in Peshawar, Pakistan, has risen to 90, a hospital spokesperson said Tuesday.

entries.title: How Holocaust survivors educate young German students about the tragedy
entries.description: January 27th is internationally recognized as Holocaust Remembrance Day meant to honor the millions of victims and survivors around the globe. NBC’s Maura Barrett sat in on a discussion between Holocaust survivors and German students as a way to help educate younger generations on the tragedy through honest conversations.

entries.title: Secretary Blinken urges Israel, Palestine to stop violence
entries.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken called for both Israelis and Palestinians to stop a rising tide of violence. NBC News’ Kelly Cobiella reports on the escalating tensions in the Middle East.
